classes.description: The majority of observations collected during a study can be divided among three general classes: Interventions, Events, or Findings.  Datasets based on any of the general observation classes share a set of common Identifier and Timing variables. As a general rule, any valid Identifier or Timing variable is permissible for use in any submission dataset based on a general observation class. (Source: SDTM v1.3, Section 2.2)
classes.label: General Observation Class
classes.name: General Observations

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. This must be a unique number, and could be a compound identifier formed by concatenating STUDYID-SITEID-SUBJID.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.SUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Subject identifier, which must be unique within the study. Often the ID of the subject as recorded on a CRF.
datasetVariables.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
datasetVariables.name: SUBJID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.RFSTDTC

datasetVariables.description: Reference Start Date/time for the subject in ISO 8601 character format. Usually equivalent to date/time when subject was first exposed to study treatment. Required for all randomized subjects; will be null for all subjects who did not meet the milestone the date requires, such as screen failures or unassigned subjects.
datasetVariables.label: Subject Reference Start Date/Time
datasetVariables.name: RFSTDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.RFENDTC

datasetVariables.description: Reference End Date/time for the subject in ISO 8601 character format. Usually equivalent to the date/time when subject was determined to have ended the trial, and often equivalent to date/time of last exposure to study treatment. Required for all randomized subjects; null for screen failures or unassigned subjects.
datasetVariables.label: Subject Reference End Date/Time
datasetVariables.name: RFENDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.RFXSTDTC

datasetVariables.description: First date of exposure to any protocol-specified treatment or therapy, equal to the earliest value of EXSTDTC.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of First Study Treatment
datasetVariables.name: RFXSTDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.RFXENDTC

datasetVariables.description: Last date of exposure to any protocol-specified treatment or therapy, equal to the latest value of EXENDTC (or the latest value of EXSTDTC if EXENDTC was not collected or is missing).
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Last Study Treatment
datasetVariables.name: RFXENDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.RFICDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/time of informed consent in ISO 8601 character format. This will be the same as the date of informed consent in the Disposition domain, if that protocol milestone is documented. Would be null only in studies not collecting the date of informed consent.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Informed Consent
datasetVariables.name: RFICDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.RFPENDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/time when subject ended participation or follow-up in a trial, as defined in the protocol, in ISO 8601 character format. Should correspond to the last known date of contact. Examples include completion date, withdrawal date, last follow-up, date recorded for lost to follow up, or death date.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of End of Participation
datasetVariables.name: RFPENDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.DTHDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/time of death for any subject who died, in ISO 8601 format. Should represent the date/time that is captured in the clinical-trial database.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Death
datasetVariables.name: DTHDTC

datasetVariables.name: DTHFL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.ARMCD

datasetVariables.description: ARMCD is limited to 20 characters and does not have special character restrictions. The maximum length of ARMCD is longer than for other "short" variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials. For example, if ARMCD values for a seven-period crossover were constructed using two-character abbreviations for each treatment and separating hyphens, the length of ARMCD values would be 20.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Arm Code
datasetVariables.name: ARMCD

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.ARM

datasetVariables.description: Name of the Arm to which the subject was assigned.
datasetVariables.label: Description of Planned Arm
datasetVariables.name: ARM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.ACTARMCD

datasetVariables.description: Code of actual Arm. When an Arm is not planned (not in Trial Arms), ACTARMCD will be UNPLAN. Randomized subjects who were not treated will be given a value of NOTTRT. Values should be "SCRNFAIL" for screen failures and "NOTASSGN" for subjects not assigned to treatment. Restricted to values in Trial Arms in all other cases. ACTARMCD is limited to 20 characters and does not have special character restrictions. The maximum length of ACTARMCD is longer than for other short variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials.
datasetVariables.label: Actual Arm Code
datasetVariables.name: ACTARMCD

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.ACTARM

datasetVariables.description: Description of actual Arm. When an Arm is not planned (not in Trial Arms), ACTARM will be "Unplanned Treatment". Randomized subjects who were not treated will be given a value of "Not Treated". Values should be "Screen Failure" for screen failures and "Not Assigned" for subjects not assigned to treatment. Restricted to values in Trial Arms in all other cases.
datasetVariables.label: Description of Actual Arm
datasetVariables.name: ACTARM

datasets.label: Demographics

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SE.ETCD

datasetVariables.description: 1. ETCD (the companion to ELEMENT) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that ETCD will need to serve as a variable name. 2. If an encountered Element differs from the planned Element to the point that it is considered a new Element, then use "UNPLAN" as the value for ETCD to represent this Element.

datasetVariables.name: ETCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable EG.EGSTRESC

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from EGORRES in a standard format or standard units. EGSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in EGSTRESN. For example, if a test has results of "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in EGORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in EGSTRESC as "NEGATIVE". For other examples, see general assumptions. Additional examples of result data: SINUS BRADYCARDIA, ATRIAL FLUTTER, ATRIAL FIBRILLATION.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RELREC.RELID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SUPPQUAL.QNAM

datasetVariables.description: The short name of the Qualifier variable, which is used as a column name in a domain view with data from the parent domain. The value in QNAM cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST"). QNAM cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. This will often be the column name in the sponsor's operational dataset.
datasetVariables.label: Qualifier Variable Name
datasetVariables.name: QNAM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SUPPQUAL.QLABEL

datasetVariables.description: This is the long name or label associated with QNAM. The value in QLABEL cannot be longer than 40 characters. This will often be the column label in the sponsor's original dataset.

datasetVariables.description: Result of, response to, or value associated with QNAM. A value for this column is required; no records can be in SUPP-- with a null value for QVAL.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SUPPQUAL.QORIG

datasetVariables.description: Since QVAL can represent a mixture of collected (on a CRF), derived, or assigned items, QORIG is used to indicate the origin of this data. Examples include CRF, ASSIGNED, or DERIVED. See Section 4.1.1.8.
datasetVariables.label: Origin
datasetVariables.name: QORIG

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SUPPQUAL.QEVAL

datasetVariables.description: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Should be null for records that contain objectively collected or derived data. Some examples include ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, STATISTICIAN, DATABASE ADMINISTRATOR, CLINICAL COORDINATOR, etc.

datasetVariables.name: QEVAL
